intro: Licaria cannella, commonly known as the candlewood plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its tall, woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in diameter. It produces showy yellow flowers with red veins, which bloom in clusters during the warmer months. Licaria cannella is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some indigenous communities.
